org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode

Class Bendy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
      • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode
        • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.Bendy

  • @Disabled
public abstract class Bendy
extends com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode

    Bendy.java

    Bendy.java simplifies code for a specific robot in order to condense and quicken the development process of code for our robot. This program was written for team 15342, Aries by their main programmer.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Brian Powell
    See Also:
    LinearOpMode

      • setUp

        void setUp()
        Initializes all the variables through retrieving their values from HardwareMap.

      • initTensorFlow

        void initTensorFlow()
        Initializes TensorFlow object detection for recognizing stones in the FTC skystone competition

      • drive

        void drive(double angle,
           double power)
        Drives the robot at an angle until stopped
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle that the robot moves at. This is not the orientation of the robot.
        power - The power that the robot sets to the drive system. Between 1 and -1.

      • drive

        void drive(double y,
           double x,
           double turn)
        Drives the robot at a certain degree on an x and y plane based on the power set in those directions
        Parameters:
        y - The power set to the forward and backwards movement. Between 1 and -1.
        x - The power set to the sideways movement. Between 1 and -1.
        turn - The power set for the rotation of the robot. Between 1 and -1.

      • drive

        void drive(double y,
           double x,
           double turn,
           int position)
        Drives on an x and y plane based on encoder units. This method will stop the motors after they reach their destination for the position parameter.
        Parameters:
        y - The power set to the forward and backwards movement. Between 1 and -1.
        x - The power set to the sideways movement. Between 1 and -1.
        turn - The power set for the rotation of the robot. Between 1 and -1.
        position - The position for the robot to run to. Ex. 3000 would be 3000 encoder units

      • drive

        void drive(double y,
           double x,
           double turn,
           int position,
           int runAngle)
        Drives the robot on an x and y axis, runs the robot to a position, and uses the gyro sensor to keep the robot aligned to a certain rotation.
        Parameters:
        y - The power set to the forward and backwards movement. Between 1 and -1.
        x - The power set to the sideways movement. Between 1 and -1.
        turn - The power set for the rotation of the robot. Between 1 and -1.
        position - The position for the robot to run to. Ex. 3000 would be 3000 encoder units
        runAngle - The angle, in degrees, at which the robot should remain at by using the gyro sensor.

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(java.lang.String name,
                 double position)
        Deprecated. 
        sets the position of a servo
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the servo in the configuration file.
        position - The position that the servo needs to be set to.

      • move

        void move(java.lang.String name,
          double power,
          int position)
        moves a motor to a certain position.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the motor in the configuration
        power - The power that the motor will be set to. Between 0 and 1.
        position - The position that the motor will be set to.
        See Also:
        encoderStop(java.lang.String)

      • encoderStop

        void encoderStop(java.lang.String name)
        Waits for a motor to reach its target position, then allows for the code to proceed. This is good for having multiple movements happening at the same time.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the motor in the configuration.
        See Also:
        move(java.lang.String, double, int)

      • toggleButton

        boolean toggleButton(java.lang.String name,
                     boolean button)
        Returns when a button has been pressed on the gamepad.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the button
        button - The button's current value
        Returns:
        A double which shows whether or not the button has been pressed once
        See Also:
        names

      • gyroAlign

        void gyroAlign(double position)
        Aligns the robot to a certain angle.
        Parameters:
        position - the angle, in degrees, to have the robot run to.

      • gyroCalibrate

        void gyroCalibrate()
        Sets up the gyroSensor to be used

      • clamp

        void clamp()
        Toggles the state of the claw on the robot
